newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Highlights of Tuesday's Commission briefing.
newsitem.headline: Highlights of Tuesday's Commission briefing.

text.p: Following are highlights of the midday briefing by the European Commission on Tuesday:
Spokesman Nikolaus van der Pas said the joint news conference by Commissioner Sir Leon Brittan and Australian Foreign Minister Alexander Downer would be held at 1440/1340 on Wednesday.

Van der Pas also said the Commission's weekly meeting would start at 0900/0800 GMT. The agenda would include a proposal to impose fines on member states that did not respect Court of Justice judgments (art 171 of the EU Treaty), Value Added Tax in the field of telecoms, environmental taxes and levies in the internal market and structural policy objective 2 aid for French Aquitaine and Germany. Van der Pas said a decision concerning the communication on olives and olive oil could be postponed because of the absence of several Commissioners.
The Commission released the following documents:
- IP/97/58: Barriers to trade: infringement against France, Italy, Belgium, Germany and Spain.
- IP/97/59: A new round of negotiations with South Africa.
- IP/97/60: Presentation of the first volume of the inventory of the European Coal and Steel Community's High Authority records.
- IP/97/61: Social legislation: State of transposition.
- IP/97/62: Football against racism - European Commission and UEFA cooperate.
- Eurostat news release No7/97: EU trade surplus with Mediterranean hits 13.7 bn Ecu.
- Eurostat - Statistics in focus - External trade No 1996-13: EU trade with the Mediterranean countries, results of 1995.
